snippet: The leaders said that accusations of corruption had created “a crisis of confidence,” a statement that was their most direct intervention in politics yet.
abstract: Sultans of nine Malaysian states ask for rapid and transparent investigation into corruption scandal involving Prime Min Najib Razak, saying incident has caused crisis of confidence; their request garners support for anti-corruption officials who are investigating wrongdoing but are being targeted by government crackdown; case involves almost $700 million Najib allegedly received from companies linked to sovereign wealth fund, 1Malaysia Development Berhad, which he oversees.
lead_paragraph: The leaders said that accusations of corruption had created “a crisis of confidence,” a statement that was their most direct intervention in politics yet.

headline.main: State Rulers in Malaysia Press for Inquiry Into Premier, Najib Razak
headline.print_headline: Traditional Leaders Press for a Graft Inquiry in Malaysia
